question: In which year, El Salvador and Honduras fought the "Football War"?
explanation: In the year 1969, El Salvador and Honduras fought the "Football War". The Football War, also known as Soccer War or the Hundred Hours' War, was a brief war fought between El Salvador and Honduras in 1969. Existing tensions between the two countries coincided with rioting during a 1970 FIFA World Cup qualifier. The war began on 14 July 1969, when the Salvadoran military launched an attack against Honduras. The Organization of American States (OAS) negotiated a cease-fire on the night of 18 July, which took full effect on 20 July. Salvadoran troops were withdrawn in early August.
